{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3533662,"name":"","username":"Raysine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/e495f1/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T00:16:23.023Z","cooked":"

We’re trying to use a rev through bore encoder to control our arm position (shoulder in code) and it looks like it’s reading our button inputs, but it’s not actually moving the motor. The spark max has the brushless encoder error which makes me think the through bore encoder isn’t plugged in correctly. We’re confused because everything looks correct as it is now, and we’ve narrowed it down to either a code issue or an encoder issue.

Link to code v

Code

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T00:16:23.023Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":184.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492394,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/o-bots7160/2025-frc-reefscape","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - o-bots7160/2025-frc-reefscape: A repository for assets related to the 2025 FIRST Robotics Competition REEFSCAPE challenge for the Ludington O-Bots team 7160.","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55669,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead programmer for 7160"},"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo/492394/1","custom_user_title":"Lead programmer for 7160","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3533674,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T00:38:00.699Z","cooked":"

Your PositionalMotor never sets the feedback sensor to the throughbore. Because of that it is probably set to the default.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T00:38:00.699Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":93,"readers_count":92,"score":23.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492394,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo/492394/2","custom_user_title":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3533681,"name":"","username":"Raysine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/e495f1/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T00:46:56.519Z","cooked":"

Where would we set that? I thought we were doing that with our config file.

Do you have a picture of your spark max? The most common cause of the error you describe is not having things plugged in correctly. The data cable from the Neo needs to go straight into the spark max, while the data cable from the throughbore encoder goes into the top through a breakout board, similar to the picture below:

IMG_72081645×2193 627 KB

It looks like it’s wired correctly, we don’t have it mounted to anything because we’re just testing it

Check the data cable for the motor. It’s hard to tell from the picture, but it looks like the green wire in the cable may be broken - if any of those wires is broken or pulled out of the connector it’ll cause a problem.

Looking closer it is broken. We’re done for the day today, but we’ll see if that’s the issue with it.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T01:03:23.927Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":62,"readers_count":61,"score":12.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492394,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55669,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead programmer for 7160"},"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo/492394/7","custom_user_title":"Lead programmer for 7160","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3533809,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T02:23:01.438Z","cooked":"

Your broken wire was probably the source of the error, but the code still needed to have.
config.closedLoop.feedbackSensor(FeedbackSensor.kAbsoluteEncoder); I have made a pull request with a small example of how you could do that and make it still work for non-absolute subsystems.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T02:23:01.438Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":11.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492394,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55669,"username":"Raysine","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/e495f1/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60512,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work."},"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo/492394/8","custom_user_title":"Doubling the current limit does not make it work.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556098,"name":"","username":"ebrooks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/7ab992/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T15:04:35.168Z","cooked":"

Our team is struggling as well.

All I’m getting from the absolute encode is 0.0 which I assume means no reading. I can’t seem to upload all of the code (GitHub keeps disconnecting mid-upload) but I have the robot file. Here

We also don’t have the rev connection piece so we used a break board and soldered the wires. (Shown Below)

For a while the spark max was blinking orange and magenta but I worked with the code to this point and it stopped. Now I don’t know how to progress.

20250313_1049341920×2560 256 KB

20250313_1049551920×2560 76.2 KB

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T15:04:35.168Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":31,"readers_count":30,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492394,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/eBrooks0/Through-Bore-Encoder-to-Neo.git","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - eBrooks0/Through-Bore-Encoder-to-Neo: A test code for using a through bore encoder for position control with neo motor,","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44480,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo/492394/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556200,"name":"","username":"Raysine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/e495f1/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T16:46:47.758Z","cooked":"

Orange and magenta should mean there’s a sensor fault which could be because you don’t have the Neo’s attached sensor cables plugged in (I can’t really see from the picture) and the SparkMAX light turning off is probably something to do with power going into it.

With your code it looks like you are trying to look at the difference between your encoder object and directly calling the .absoluteEncoder method in the motor. I don’t think there should be a difference, but if there is could you share it?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T16:46:47.758Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":24,"readers_count":23,"score":9.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492394,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44480,"username":"ebrooks","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/7ab992/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55669,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead programmer for 7160"},"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo/492394/10","custom_user_title":"Lead programmer for 7160","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556216,"name":"","username":"ebrooks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/7ab992/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T17:04:49.193Z","cooked":"

So I managed to get the orange and megenta to stop and. the spark max now reads normal. I’m guessing I configured it wrong to start.

I was comparing the two and originally there was a difference but I managed to fix that and am not getting the same results for both sets of prints. Still 0.0 for the position.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T17:04:49.193Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":23,"readers_count":22,"score":9.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492394,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":55669,"username":"Raysine","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/e495f1/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44480,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo/492394/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556222,"name":"","username":"Raysine","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/e495f1/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T17:13:30.304Z","cooked":"

Ok, looking closer at the 2nd picture it looks like you might have to solder that white wire to the board. I assume you’re using the rev throughbore encoder which I’m pretty sure requires all of the wires be connected, which would mean your board doesn’t have all the necessary connections (I think)

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T17:13:30.304Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":24,"readers_count":23,"score":4.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492394,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":44480,"username":"ebrooks","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/7ab992/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55669,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Lead programmer for 7160"},"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-controlling-neo/492394/12","custom_user_title":"Lead programmer for 7160","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556234,"name":"","username":"ebrooks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/7ab992/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T17:27:58.758Z","cooked":"

So the white wire is connected to the bottom GNDd. You think we need the other wires connected besides the three shown?
